origin: Mid 17th century; earliest use found in Thomas Case (d. 1682), clergyman and ejected minister. From pro- + post-classical Latin cursivus cursive<br>late 19th century; earliest use found in The Lancet. From French procursif or its etymon post-classical Latin procursivus from classical Latin prōcurs-, past participial stem of prōcurrere to run forward + -īvus; compare cursive.
